node.Place of issue: No place
node.Title: GCBC 00457

node.Type and content: Records of Transfer
node.Paraphrase:
The tablet lists the sacrificial sheep (immeru sattukku) that were brought in (abāku, Stat.) from (ina qātē) the shepherds (rēˀû) in the 27th of Ṭebēt (X) year 3 (Nebuchadnezzar):

incoming list: 10 from A1, 14 from A2, his brother, 10 from A3, 24 from A4, 15 from A5, [10] from A6.

The Eanna temple received (mahāru, Stat.) these animals, total (napharu) of 83 sheep and goats (ṣēnu), from B1, brother of B2. They are now under the responsibility (ina pāni) of C the offering shepherd (rēˀu sattukku/ginê).

 

A1= Marduk-zēru-ibni/Mudammiq-māti (sig5.kur), brother of A2; A2= Bēl-ahu-[x]/Mudammiq-māti(?), brother of A1; A3= Ahu-Aya/Manna-kī-ili; A4= Nergal-ibni/Lâbâši; A5= Nabû- nāṣir/Zabidâ; A6= Rēmūt/Nanāya-iddin; B1= Marduk-erība/Šulāya, brother of B2; B2= Nanāya-iddin, brother of B1; C= Kudurru, offering shepherd (rēˀu sattukku/ginê);

node.Paraphrase:
The temple received (mahāru, Stat.) 19 male lambs (parru) from A for the offerings (sattukku) of next month, Arahsamna (VIII). The animals are under the responsibility (pānu) of B1 and B2.

 

A= Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Iamaˀa (ia-ma!-ˀa); B1= Tukulti-Marduk/Kudurru; B2= Kiribtu/Bēl-nāṣir; B1 and B2 are two well-known offering shepherds.

node.Type and content: Records of Transfer
node.Paraphrase:
The Eanna temple received (mahāru, Stat.) 10 sacrificial sheep (immeru sattukku) from A, the shepherd of two brothers, B1 and B2, to whom the sheep belong. The animals are now put under the responsibility (pānu) of C, the offering shepherd (rēˀu sattukku/ginê).

 

A= Ahu-lūmur; B1= Nabû-ēṭir/Nabû-ahu-ēreš, brother of B2; B2= Šuma-ukīn/Nabû-ahu-ēreš, brother of B1; C= Tukulti-Marduk, offering shepherd (rēˀu sattukku/ginê)

node.Title: GCBC 00473

node.Type and content: Records of Transfer
node.Paraphrase:
The tablet records the fixed rent (sūtu) of A: 57;1.1.3 kor of barley and 2;2.3 kor of spelt, total (napharu) of 59;3.4.3 kor of grain. B1, B2, and B3 measured it (mašāhu) in A’s house in Til-agurrāti in Ulūl (VI) 34 Nbk.

Of these (ina libbi): 51;4.3.3 kor of barley (and) 2;2.3 kor of spelt were delivered (našû, Stat.) to the temple’s storehouse (makkūru), the harbour master (rab kāre) drew (našû) 1;3.4.3 kor, and 2;0.2.3 kor were lost (maṭû, D) in the silo (kalakku).

 

A= Ibni-Ištar/Nabû-šumu-ibni, a known decurion and an agricultural supervisor; B1= Nādin/Nadnāya; B2= Mušēzib-Bēl/Aplāya; B3= Marduk-erība/Bēl-iddin

node.Title: NCBT 00101

node.Type and content: Records of Transfer
node.Paraphrase:
incoming: The Eanna temple received (mahāru, Stat.) from A, as general income (irbu), 1 young he-goat (gadû) that was previously entrusted (paqādu, Stat.) with C for (ana) pasture (rēˀû). Then, outgoing: B, the temple’s offering shepherd (rēˀi sattukku/ginû) handed it over (nadānu) to D.

 

A= Zēria/Bēl-šumu-iškun; B= Nabû-ušallim/Kudurru, offering shepherd (rēˀi sattukku/ginû); C= Nabû-ušallim; D= Balāssu/Ḫašdāya

node.Title: NBC 01161

node.Type and content: Records of Transfer
node.Paraphrase:
incoming: The Eanna temple received (mahāru, Stat.) 110 sheep and goats (ṣēnu) of A from his messenger (mār šipri) B, as general income (irbu), and inner transfer: put them under the responsibility (ina pāni) of C, the temple’s offering shepherd (rēˀi sattukku/ginû).

 

A= Qallaˀ/Sāsia; B= Nūrānu, messenger (mār šipri) of A; C= Kudurru, offering shepherd (rēˀi sattukku/ginû)

node.Title: HMA 9-02474

node.Type and content: Records of Transfer
node.Paraphrase:
The tablet lists woven cloths (mihṣu) that the Eanna temple gave (nadānu, wr. sum-nu) to weavers (išparu), and one unnamed launderer (pūṣāya), for (ana) repairs (batqu). This header-like info is added at the end of the text.

1 lubāru-garment and 1 šalhu-garment are at the disposal (ina pāni) of fA1 for sewing (kubbû); 2 lubāru-garments of the (divine) Ladies/Mistresses (dgašanmeš) are at the disposal of A2 and A3; 1 lubāru-garment is at the disposal of A2; 1 cloth-cover (hullānu) is at the disposal of A3; and 6 šalhu-garments are at the disposal of the launderer for (ana) cleaning (zikûtu).

 

A1= fḪipāya, weaver (išparu); A2= Nanāya-ēreš (/Nabû-ušallim), weaver (išparu), see Payne 2007 (PhD diss.), 186f.; A3= Ṭāb-Uruk (/Balāssu?), weaver (išparu) and a known temple-serf, see Payne 2007 (PhD diss.), 200.

node.Title: YBC 09623

node.Paraphrase:
Total of 69 sheep and goats (ṣēnu) are listed (but the animals listed add up to 68, not 69) on the 2nd of Addar (XII). Of these animals, inner transfer: 2 are allocated to (ana, but no verb) the fattening stables (urû), outgoing: 67 to the fold (qabuttu) under A’s responsibility (ina pāni), and 5 (1 kalūmu + 4 parratu) put at the disposal (ina pāni) of B.

 

A= Ibnāya/Nabû-ahhē-šullim; B= Šūzubu

A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Ubāru/Dummuqu//Tunāya

No protagonists are legible.

node.Title: VAT 02008

node.Paraphrase:
Hire of a person(?) (heavily damaged): The details of the contract cannot be reconstructed. 4 shekels of silver are mentioned and the wages of some person referenced, in connection with A, B [who takes(?)] responsibility for C, and with D. At least 3 witnesses, remainder lost.
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = [...]/Bēl-šumu-iddin; C = Bēl-ittannu; D = Artamišu

node.Title: VAT 02000

node.Paraphrase: Lease of prebendary duties (heavily damaged): Only a few meat items of income of certain days, of the 4th and the 17th day can be perceived on the heavily damaged obverse of the tablet. A seems to be the lessee (given the expression ana A [...] iddin) of the prebend. His duty extends [fr]om the 10th day to [x]. 3 witnesses and the scribe(?) ([...]/Iqūpu//Šumu-libši). The dating is lost apart from the damaged indication of the year. A = Šellebu[/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu]

node.Title: VAT 01920+

node.Type and content: Promissory notes ina muẖẖi
node.Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver with prebend as security: B owes to A 1 minas 3 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20%), which will commence with the 1st of Ayyāru (II) of the 28th year (of Darius) (scil. the following month). B’s prebend in the temple of Išhara is the security of A. 6 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-asûa/[Iddin-Nabû]//Atkuppu).
 
A = Ana-Bēl-upāqu/Šamaš-erība//Munnabittu; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

node.Title: VAT 01895+

node.Paraphrase:
Purchase of slave: fB sells fC, whose hands are inscribed with the name of fA, to fA for 2 1/3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. Full payment has been made. A clause follows concerning D1’s and D2’s responsibility regarding fC, in the case of lawsuits (pūt sihî), vindication (pūt pāqirāni) and claims for the status of a royal slave woman (amat šarrūti) or freedom (mār banûti). 1 ina ašābi-witness, the mother of fB (fTabluṭu/Bēl-iddin/Rēˀi-sīsê), 11 witnesses (including 1 witness added later), and the scribe (Mudammiq-Nabû/Nabû-zēr-līšir).
 
fA = fTabluṭu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu; fB = fKusippitu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Rēˀi-sīsê; fC = fBānītu- rēˀûa (slave of fB); D1 = Bēl-ittannu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Sūhāya; D2 = Mūrānu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Sūhāya

node.Title: VAT 00180

node.Paraphrase:
Receipt of gift of silver: A, messenger [mār šipri] of the ša-muhhi-bītāni, receives in payment (eṭēru) from C the gift  (qīštu) of (an unspecified amount of) silver of B. The tablet is sealed with a seal probably associated with the ša-muḫḫi-bīt­āni.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin/Uṣur-ilia (messenger [mār šipri] of the ša-muhhi-bītāni); B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu

node.Title: VAT 00122

node.Paraphrase:
Note of credit arrangement by proxy: A draws up a promissory note (uˀiltu) against B at the behest of C for 5/6 mina 5 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The document stresses that the silver belongs to C and not to A. A is to register (izuzzu Š) the promissory note and give (proof of) it to C. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nidintu-Marduk//Rab-banê).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Rēmūt-Nabû/Ina-ṣilli-Bēl//Nuhāšu; C = Erībāya/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

node.Paraphrase:
Receipt for dates: B owes A 8;2 kor of dates with interest. A receives them and their interest according to B’s promissory note (uˀiltu). A clause against further promissory notes against B follows. A is to hand over the promissory note on the 2nd day of month [x] to B. 7 witnesses (1 witness added on the edge), and [the scribe] (Ea-iddin/Na[bû-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa).
 
A = Nergal-nāṣir/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Pahāru; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

node.Body:
Concerning purchase of prebend [only fragment]: The fragment concerns the (butcher’s) prebend and corresponding tablet of purchase of A from B (cf. BM77478+?). It contains a clause concerning the defense of the purchase by B against future disputes and claims. [Rest of tablet lost]
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk
node.Place of issue: Babylon city
node.Title: BM 077681

node.Type and content: Promissory notes ina muẖẖi

Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1/3 mina of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. He is to pay in Simānu (III) of the 25th year of Darius. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Širiktu-Marduk/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Sîn-damāqu).
 
A = Ana-Bēl-upāqu/Ea-zēru-ibni//Bāˀiru; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

node.Title: BM 077592+

node.Paraphrase:
Dowry receipt: A is paid (eṭēru) the dowry of his wife fC by (ina qāt) B. It comprises: 8 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy with 1 mina of quppu-silver, 2 slaves, a table (paššūru), a pot stand (gangannu), a bed (gišná) with dimigirru and fig-ornaments (tittu), a small bed (eršu qallatu) with a musukkannu-attachment (musukkannu mandītu), a footstool (šupāl šēpi), a woman’s(?) chair (kussû ša sinniš[ti]), a lamp (bīt nūru), a bronze (lamp) stand (kallu siparru), a bronze lantern (šāšītu siparru), a bronze brazier (mušahhin sip[arri]), 3 bronze cups (kāsu), a bronze baṭû-vessel, a bronze ladle (nāṭilu), 2 bronze strainers (šāhilu), a bronze mukarrišu-vessel, a bronze grate(?) (kišukku), a wooden chest (gišarannu), 3 muṣiptu-garments, and an upper(?) kišku-cloth (kišku an.na); the earlier receipt of 5 5/6 minas of silver included. 6 witnesses, including the brother-in-law of B (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (= A).
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fTabluṭ/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu

node.Title: BM 077570

node.Type and content: Receipts of income
node.Paraphrase:
Receipt for prebendary meat: A receives (mahāru) from B prebendary meat of [...] of ox and sheep before Išhara from Dûzu (IV) of the 29th year till the end of Simānu (III) of the 30th year. 5 witnesses and the scribe ([...]//Rab-banê).
 
A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Lūṣi-ana-nūr (agent [bēl piqitti] of the one in charge of the cashbox [ša-muhhi-quppi]); B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

node.Title: BM 077563

node.Type and content: Promissory notes ina muẖẖi
node.Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1 ½ minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy, which was originally owed to C. The debt bears a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina. He is to pay the debt plus interest in Nisannu (I) of the [2]5th year. 5 witnesses and the scribe ([...//E]gibi).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Bēl-iddin/Rēmūtu//Atkuppu; C = Iddin-Nabû(/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu) (father of A)

node.Place of issue: Babylon city
node.Title: BM 077544

node.Paraphrase:
Receipt of silver, price of a butcher’s prebend: fA1 receives (mahāru) 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy from B, which is the price of the butcher’s prebend in Ešasurra, the temple of Išhara, that C sold to him (as it was made known [edû Š] in BM77478+). fA1 returns to B the corresponding promissory note (uˀiltu; cf. BM77521) and the tablet concerning the dispute over the prebend with D (cf. BM77417). 10 witnesses extant; indication of scribe and dating lost.
 
fA1 = Kabtāya/Damqiya; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Bēl-ereš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk; D = Bēl-iddin/Nergal-ušēzib//Ileˀˀi-Marduk

node.Paraphrase:
Promissory note (heavily damaged): B owes fA an unkown commodity. He is to pay it in Tašrītu (VII). 4 witnesses, including an oblate of Marduk (širku, širik Marduk) (Bēl-nāṣir/Nabû-ušallim), and the scribe ([...]-Bēl/[...//...]).
 
fA = f[...]/Ṣāṣiru//Ahiau; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

node.Title: BM 077527

node.Type and content: Promissory notes ina muẖẖi
node.Paraphrase:
Promissory note for silver, price of a butcher’s prebend: fA draws up (eˀēlu) against B a promissory note (uˀiltu) over 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. This silver is the price of her butcher’s prebend in Ešasurra, the temple of Išhara, which C had sold to B for said price in an earlier tablet (scil. BM77478+).  Should a dispute (ragāmu) or claim (paqāru) arise over the prebend fA is to return this promissory note and B is to return the purchase tablet of the prebend. 9 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Saggilāya).
 
fA = Kabtāya/Damqia; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Ana-Bēl-ereš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk

node.Place of issue: Babylon city
node.Title: BM 077521

node.Paraphrase:
Sale of butcher’s prebend of Išhara: B sold voluntarily (ina migir libbišu) to A his butcher’s prebend in Ešasurra, the temple of Išhara in Šuanna, for 3 minas of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The prebend comprises ox and sheep from the royal offerings, offerings of the kāribu, ginû-offerings, qiqqû-offerings, offerings of the eššēšu-festivals, bayyānūtu-offerings, greeting of the temple (šalām bīti) offerings, coils (tīrānu), brain(?) (g[ab]bu), gan ṣēli-meat, trimmings (nukāsātu), epigastrium (karšu), naṣrappu-meat, 2 ankle cuts (kursinnu), omasum (riqītu), bāb urkāti-meat, hilidamu-meat, and fatty tissue around the intestines (hinṣu) not cut off (qarāšu), for the whole year. B receives the money from A and is thus paid. Standard final clause excluding further litigation follows. 14 witnesses, including a judge (Nabû-bēlšunu//[?]), and the scribe (Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Saggilāya).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk

node.Place of issue: Babylon city
node.Title: BM 077478+

node.Type and content: Statements in court/Depositions
node.Paraphrase:
Statement at court concerning a dispute over an unpaid debt: B owes 50 shekels of cut silver to A. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina. Concerning this debt note (uˀiltu) A states that C1 drew it up (eˀēlu) in the name of fC2 against (ina muhhi) B and that fC2 confirmes (kânu) this. (Rest of statement is lost) 2 witnesses, a judge (Bēl-supê-muhur//[-]) and an uppadētu-official (Nabû-nādin-ahi//Ēṭiru), and the scribe (Mušēzib-Bēl//Egibi).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu; B = Rēmūtu/Nabû-šumu-līšir/Bēl-aplu-uṣur; C1 = Iddin-Nabû (Iddināya)/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (father of A); fC2 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu (mother of A)

node.Title: BM 077424

node.Paraphrase:
Dispute over purchase of butcher’s prebend: B raises a claim on the butcher’s prebend before Išhara that C bought from A2 (cf. BM77478+) and regarding which fA1 drew up a promissory note (uˀiltu) over 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy (cf. BM77521). fA1 pays B 1 mina of white silver to settle the dispute. A clause against further litigation follows, including the return of the 1 mina of silver to fA1 and this tablet to B in case of further claims. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-iqīša/Šumu-iddin//Lēˀêa).
 
fA1 = Kabtāya/Damqia; A2 = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B = Bēl-iddin/Nergal-ušēzib//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; C = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

Dispute over purchase of butcher’s prebend: B raises a claim on the butcher’s prebend before Išhara that C bought from A2 (cf. BM77478+) and regarding which fA1 drew up a promissory note (uˀiltu) over 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy (cf. BM77521). fA1 pays B 1 mina of white silver to settle the dispute. A clause against further litigation follows, including the return of the 1 mina of silver to fA1 and this tablet to B in case of further claims. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-iqīša/Šumu-iddin//Lēˀêa).
 
fA1 = Kabtāya/Damqia; A2 = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B = Bēl-iddin/Nergal-ušēzib//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; C = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

node.Paraphrase:
Dowry contract: B gives dowry (nudunnû) with his daughter fC to A. The dowry consists of: 8 minas of white cut silver with 1 mina of quppu-silver of 1/8 alloy, (the slaves) fŠa-Ninlil-ūda and […]-ana-ahhē[šu](?) and household goods (udê bīti; see BM77399+ for details on these goods). The tablet was sealed before (ina kanāk ṭuppi) 10 witnesses, including the brother-in-law of B (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), the brothers of fC (Šellebu and Bēl-ēṭir/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu), and the scribe (Ea-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa). 2 [ina ašā]bi-witnesses(?), including the wife of B (fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi).
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fTabluṭ/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu

node.Title: BM 077400

node.Paraphrase:
Dowry receipt: A is paid (eṭēru) the dowry of his wife fC by (ina qāt) B. It comprises: 8 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy with 1 mina of quppu-silver, 2 slaves, a table (paššūru), a pot stand (gangannu), a bed (gišná) with dimigirru and fig-ornaments (tittu), a small bed (eršu qallatu) with a musukkannu-attachment (musukkannu mandītu), a footstool (šupāl šēpi), a woman’s(?) chair (kussû ša sinniš[ti]), a lamp (bīt nūru), a bronze (lamp) stand (kallu siparru), a bronze lantern (šāšītu siparru), a bronze brazier (mušahhin sip[arri]), 3 bronze cups (kāsu), a bronze baṭû-vessel, a bronze ladle (nāṭilu), 2 bronze strainers (šāhilu), a bronze mukarrišu-vessel, a bronze grate(?) (kišukku), a wooden chest (gišarannu), 3 muṣiptu-garments, and an upper(?) kišku-cloth (kišku an.na); the earlier receipt of 5 5/6 minas of silver included. 6 witnesses, including the brother-in-law of B (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (= A).
 
A = Nidintu-Marduk/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fTabluṭ/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu

node.Title: BM 077391

node.Paraphrase: Land rental. A and his brothers rent land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) located along the Bitqu-ša-Ile’’i-Bēl to B, who should perform gardening work (nukaribbūtu). In Abu (V) he should carry out the excavation work for irrigation; he will take care of the palm fronds (libbu) and branches (harūtu). He will not cut off sprouts (raṭbu). As long as he will dig ditches using a winnowing shovel (pīsu) and remove lumps (parku) from the ground, he will receive 5 kor (900 l) of dates per kor that he will have farmed as gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Kalbāya/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi   A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Tabnēa/Marduk-šumu-uṣur-ibni//Ša-nāšīšu

node.Title: BM 030912

node.Paraphrase:
Receipt for silver. Payment for a debt by a third person

fA1 and A2 (her husband) receive the ½ mina and 5 shekels of silver that B owes to fA1. The silver is paid to them by C.  fD, a slave who also goes by the name Šalam-dīninni was pledged (to secure the debt), and should no doubt be returned to the debtor. Note that the creditors had under-pledged this slave for one of their own debts (BM33156 = Nbn 390). Further note that four days later, B sells fD, his slave (together with two other slaves), to Iddn-Marduk/Iqīšaya/Nūr-Sîn who sends C, his son-in-law to pay to the seller: BM30810 (= Nbn 392) records B's receipt of the purchase price. 

 

fA1 = fBunanītu/Na’id-Marduk/Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Ēṭiru (husband of fA1); B = Nabu-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni/Nappāhu; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fD = fṬābatu (aka: Šalam-dīninni), a slave

node.Title: 76-11-17,2627

node.Bibliography: Neo- and Late Babylonian Business Documents from the John Frederick Lewis Collection.
node.Title: FLP 1421

node.Paraphrase:
Purchase of land. Receipt of purchase price

A buys 0;1.5.5.8 sq. kor (c. 5325 m2) of land from fB for 1 minas and 55 1/2 shekels of silver. It is a plot of land located in the open country (ṣēru), an orchard (kirû) planted with date palms (gišimmarē zaqpu) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti) and ... (lacuna), within (birīt) the upper palmgrove (gišimmaru elēnu) in Hursagkalamma, in the district (pīhatu) of Kiš. The field is described according to the neighbouring properties (among others, the house of the šatammu), then it is acknowledged that fB has received (mahāru Stat.) 1 mina and 55 ½ shekels of silver as the total purchase price (šīmu gamru) for this land, plus 2 ½ shekels as additional payment (atru). In total, fB receives 2 minas and 1 shekels of clipped silver (šibirtu) from A. The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. Names of 4+ witnesses (introduced by the formula ina kanakka ṭuppi šuati). A broken passage at the end of the witness list and before the scribe’s name, refers to fB, “seller” (nādinatu) of the field; then it is said that her daughter fC, also labelled“seller” (nādinatu) of the field, whose equalising payment (takpurtu) corresponds to 1 shekel of silver, was present(?) (ina ušuzzi or ina ašabi, reconstructed). This is followed by the name of the scribe: Bēl-ibni/Bēlšunu//Rē'i-sīsê. Finally, the text states that the fingernails (ṣupru) of the seller are impressed on the tablet instead of her seal impression (kunukku).

 

A = Kalbāya/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fB = fInbāya/Nabû?/Seppe; fC = fRē’indu

node.Body:
Purchase of land. Receipt of purchase price

A buys 0;1.5.5.8 sq. kor (c. 5325 m2) of land from fB for 1 minas and 55 1/2 shekels of silver. It is a plot of land located in the open country (ṣēru), an orchard (kirû) planted with date palms (gišimmarē zaqpu) bearing fruit (iṣṣi bilti) and ... (lacuna), within (birīt) the upper palmgrove (gišimmaru elēnu) in Hursagkalamma, in the district (pīhatu) of Kiš. The field is described according to the neighbouring properties (among others, the house of the šatammu), then it is acknowledged that fB has received (mahāru Stat.) 1 mina and 55 ½ shekels of silver as the total purchase price (šīmu gamru) for this land, plus 2 ½ shekels as additional payment (atru). In total, fB receives 2 minas and 1 shekels of clipped silver (šibirtu) from A. The parties agree that in future times there will be no claims or suits against each other, not even between members of their families – otherwise, any future claimant will have to repay twelvefold the silver he received. Names of 4+ witnesses (introduced by the formula ina kanakka ṭuppi šuati). A broken passage at the end of the witness list and before the scribe’s name, refers to fB, “seller” (nādinatu) of the field; then it is said that her daughter fC, also labelled“seller” (nādinatu) of the field, whose equalising payment (takpurtu) corresponds to 1 shekel of silver, was present(?) (ina ušuzzi or ina ašabi, reconstructed). This is followed by the name of the scribe: Bēl-ibni/Bēlšunu//Rē'i-sīsê. Finally, the text states that the fingernails (ṣupru) of the seller are impressed on the tablet instead of her seal impression (kunukku).

node.Place of issue: Hursagkalamma
node.Title: BM 032899

node.Type and content: Divisions (other than inheritances)
node.Paraphrase:
Transfer of ownership, subject to life interest

fA, of her own free will (ina hūd libbišu), has transferred the ownership of her properties (nikkassu) located inside and outside the city to her daughter fB under a sealed document (kanāku - dagālu Š). The transferred amount does not include 5 minas of silver, 2 slaves (amīlūtu) and household goods (udê bīti), that she previously gave to C as her daughter’s dowry (nudunnû). As long as fA will live, she will enjoy the usufruct (akalu akālu) of her assets. She cannot transfer the property (of anything) to anyone, on her own authority (šalāṭu - nadānu). The text also records that fB will not give any of the properties inherited from her mother to anyone, without (the consent of) her husband, C. When fA will die, her assets will be at fB’s disposal (ina pāni dagālu N). The text ends invoking the gods’ curse upon whomever will change (enû) the words written in this agreement (dabābu). Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

 

fA = fSilim-Ištar/Kurigalzu//Ša-nāšišu; fB = fGula-qā’išat, daughter of fA; C = Bēl-ušallim/Zēria//Nabāya

node.Title: BM 033070

node.Paraphrase:
Sale of slaves.

B voluntarily sells a family of 5 slaves to A for the hariṣ-price of 2 ½ minas and 5 shekels of silver. The slaves' names are listed below. The seller guarantees that no one will come up with a lawsuit unlawfully (sēḫû) or make a claim (paqirānu) with respect to the slaves; should this happen he will promptly return the purchase price to the buyer. Names of xxx witnesses and the scribe.

 

A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin (T: Bēl-ahhē-iddin)/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Šulāya/Ibnāya//Maštuk; C1=Bēl-eṭēri-Nabû; fC2 = fBānītu-rāmat, mother of C1; fC3= fIna-ṣilli-Esabad, sister of C1; fC4 = fRahibā, sister of C1; fC5 = fTašlim, sister of C1.

node.Title: BM 030950

node.Paraphrase: Undertaking to deliver barley in exchange for dates. Concerns the 20 kor of barley that B owes to A in exchange for (šupêltu) dates. B receives (eṭēru) the dates from A and undertakes to deliver the barley according to A’s promissory note by the end of Duzu (IV).   A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Adad-uballiṭ/Nabû-šumu-iddin
